1.text: Jesus said these things, and lifting up his eyes to heaven, he said, “Father, the time has come! Glorify your Son, so that your Son may also glorify you,

2.text: even as you gave him authority over all flesh, to give eternal life to all whom you have given him.

3.text: This is eternal life: that they should know you, the only true God, and him whom you have sent, Jesus Christ.

4.text: I have glorified you on the earth! I have accomplished the work which you have given me to do!

5.text: Now, Father, glorify me with yourself with the glory I had with you before the world existed.

6.text: I have revealed your Name to the people whom you have given me out of the world. They were yours, and you have given them to me; they have kept your word.

7.text: Now they have known that all things you have given me are from you.

8.text: The words you have given me, I have given to them. They have received them and they have known for certain that I came forth from you, and they have believed that you sent me.

9.text: I pray for them; I do not pray for the world, but for those whom you have given me, for they are yours.

10.text: All things that are mine are yours, and yours are mine, and I am glorified in them.

11.text: I am no longer in the world, but these are [still] in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, keep them through your Name which you have given me, so that they may be one, even as we are [one].

12.text: While I was with them in the world, I protected them in your Name. Those whom you have given me I have kept. None of them is lost, except the son of destruction, so that the Scripture might be fulfilled.

13.text: But now I come to you, and I say these things in the world, so that they may have my joy made full in themselves.

14.text: I have given them your word and the world has hated them because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

15.text: I do not pray that you would take them from the world, but that you would protect them from the evil one.

16.text: They are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

17.text: Sanctify them in your truth; your word is truth!

18.text: As you sent me into the world, I too have sent them into the world.

19.text: I sanctify myself for their sake, so that they too may be sanctified in truth.

20.text: I do not pray only for these, but also for those who [will] believe in me through their word,

21.text: so that they may all be one; even as you, Father, are in me, and I in you. May they be one in us, so that the world may believe that you sent me.

22.text: The glory which you have given me, I have given to them, so that they may be one even as we are one;

23.text: I in them, and you in me. May they be perfected into one, so that the world may know that you sent me, and [that you have] loved them, even as you have loved me.

24.text: Father, I desire that those whom you have given me would be with me where I am, so that they may see my glory which you have given me, for you loved me before the foundation of the world.

25.text: Righteous Father, the world has not known you, but I knew you; and these have known that you have sent me.

26.text: I have made your Name known to them, and I will [continue to] make it known; so that the love with which you loved me may be in them, and I in them.”
